title: Could anyone identify this font?
content:
I would be much obliged if anyone can identify this font for me.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/WEBCanAnyoneTellMeWhichFontIsThisPls_6396.jpg)
author: sasapetrova

comments.content: I believe this is [Jan van Krimpen](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070800/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Jan%20van%20Krimpen)'s Lutetia. Never been digitized. My friend lucked upon a font of metal Lutetia last year at a press's fire sale. The shapes have remained in my head ever since. Doyald Young wrote an article about the face and you can download it at [Type Culture](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070800/http:/typeculture.com/academic_resource/articles_essays/).

Your sample could be of the "Revised" version with the tamed 'Q':

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131018070800im_/http:/typophile.com/files/PreviewScreenSnapz001_6667.png)
